intro: Holmskioldia microphylla var. glabrescens, commonly known as the silky leaf holmskioldia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in shrubland and woodland habitats, preferring well-drained soils. It produces vibrant pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens for its attractive foliage and floral display.
